lexUnit.name: foresee.v

corpus.description: Texts from Nuclear Threat Initiative website, created by Center for Non-Proliferation Studies
corpus.name: NTI

lexUnit.definition: COD: be aware of beforehand; predict.

sentence.text: When they first shared a tent in the rainforest , how could they have foreseen that the camp would be Jane 's home for almost her entire adult life ?
Dr Paisley could not foresee that he would be in gaol during the throes of a general election .
I could foresee that these factors might lose us the seat -- even if the Conservative vote was on its best politically correct behaviour on polling day .
I foresee that this statement will excite a certain amount of comment .
He could not have foreseen that it would be Mozart , 24 years his junior , who would be dead before the year 's end .
Marx and Engels did not foresee that it was possible for capitalists to find new markets or cheaper supplies of raw materials and labour in the colonies of the Third World .
We foresee that role being adopted by the Western European Union .
A pamphleteer in 1762 foresaw that more frequent trips to London would put increasing numbers of country gentlemen " in the mode " .
Would it not be more like Satan to shoot a dart into the dreams of an unsuspecting person , so that he foresees a plane crash without any hope of helping or saying the situation ?
As well as determining the information needed now and in the near future , some regard must be given to the difficult task of trying to foresee information needs in the longer term ( Land , 1982 ) .
Admittedly , SHe foresaw he would probably be difficult about it , but that should not be a major problem .
I ached to foresee what he was planning .
You can usually foresee what is going to happen , so please let us know in advance and we will arrange the best deal for you .
I am not going to attempt today to foresee what that price will be .
And it 's quite another thing to foresee what 's going to happen , and then deliberately to prevent its happening .
The producer should reasonably foresee what might be done with the goods , such as predictable misuse by a child .
Would he have gone on to hail Middlesbrough as ` that marvellous town of iron " if he had foreseen how it would crush so much of the beauty he cherished ?
` We foresee enormous problems for local authorities in all areas , including education and housing , which are all being denied resources , " he said .
It is less sure that anyone in 1975 could have foreseen the dramatic increase in the demand for places in the ten years to follow .
Most respondents did not foresee any major changes in their way of life in the years ahead and saw no particular difficulties in continuing their present activities
Heseltine declares that he can not foresee the circumstances in which he would challenge her for the leadership .

He foresaw the Baltic region as a " region within the European Communities " and said that regional co-operation would " facilitate the linkages of the European Communities with the non-member countries of the region " .
The Princess of Wales may have foreseen the latest controversy over her marriage in the stars .
Charles winced and foresaw a painful visit to the field cashier in Lille .
` The standards for cab design have been set for one person , so we foresee problems with having two seats , " says Mr Boswell .
That alone made him foresee difficulties .
There was no need to show that she foresaw the possibility of some harm .
All these were heresies from a Marxist standpoint but then Marx had not foreseen the coming of nuclear war .
That a movement beginning as a breakaway group within Judaism should end by capturing the imperial palace could hardly have been foreseen by the Emperors Tiberius or Nero .
If the act should have been foreseen by a reasonable man as likely , it would not break the chain of causation .
It was a development that had been long foreseen , and it was inevitable .
Nevertheless the indirect ecological effects can not always be foreseen .
Demarcation problems were foreseen if a county court had to deal with a dispute involving men of different counties , or when a " criminal " fled from one county into another .
Mr Chin had foreseen this difficulty and made sure that no child had majority control of any of the family companies .
Those who foresaw the inevitability of this could take one of three ways out : commit suicide like the Itelmens ; resist and fight like the Chukchis ; or learn to get along with the newcomers .
The company could n't foresee great success or they would have tied up the band for years by way of contract options .
Positive , forward thinking is behind Wright 's plans for the polytechnic , especially in the light of the transformations she foresees in training and education .
As it stands , it is among the best of the poetry of the Oxford Movement , and probably a longer life would have produced the mastery foreseen by Bridges and James .
The hard times foreseen by Nicholas senior now came .

Deeds of variations were orginally known as deeds of family arrangement because they were generally used to re-arrange assets within a family so as to cover circumstances not foreseen by the deceased when the will was made .
Something extra , something not foreseen , something else he would have to take care of .
The main problem that Ash foresees is among the younger academic staff .

One of the criticisms that Buisseret foresaw coming from academics was that ` the bias was unexpectedly towards changes in the already strong science base rather than addressing priority problems in industry " .
And I foresee , almost without fail , the effect they will produce . "

Development of both an indigenous missile design and production capability , and the evolution of a strategic doctrine that foresees Iran as a regional superpower , `` ... a missile power second only to the superpowers , '' and a `` ... center ... '' for other third world nations seeking missile capabilities .
